item.title: 20250824.1 - Anomaly Detected
item.description:
#GOC #JournalGOC

#GOC #JournalGOC


On the road up from Rookie, past Depot and short of Rostok (GOC), a contamination of radioactive material, possibly left over by anomaly

Location: Northern stretch of the road from Rookie Village (GOC), between the old Depot (GOC)and the outskirts of Rostok (GOC).
Came across a contamination zone along the road; constant low level radiation, enough to trigger the dosimeter's low-range chirp. The hotspot isn't natural, not in the geologic sense. More likely, a remnant of an anomaly that either burned out or shifted elsewhere, leaving behind its residue.
The pattern is close together, uniform. Soil and debris in a meter radius show elevated readings. Melted asphalt, I’ve seen this before. Looks like a Fruit Punch anomaly might’ve nested here once. Maybe during the last blowout or so.
No visible emissions now, but I wouldn't linger here too long, not to mention the Flesh and Izlom's . My boots clicked over bone fragments; likely scavengers or desperate rookies. Whatever this place did, it did it fast.
I marked the spot with hazard mark on my map and scratched a warning into the roadside barrier. It’s not worth losing a foot over a shortcut to Rostok (GOC).
Recommendation: Not dangerous but a detour through the trees eastward for now to avoid the mutants. And remind the rookies ;just because the anomaly’s gone, doesn’t mean its teeth ain’t still in the dirt.
The Guide

item.title: Blind Dogs
item.description:
#GOC #Research

#GOC #Research
[!infobox|light]+
“Img” is not created yet. Click to create.


Category: Tier I Threat
Disposition: Pack-hunting, aggressive when provoked
Common Locations: Open fields, ruined villages, roadside clearings
The Blind Dog is a reminder that the Zone doesn’t need claws the size of knives to be dangerous. They look like half-starved strays at first glance — ribs showing, fur patchy, eyes clouded white or gone altogether. Don’t be fooled. Their lack of sight doesn’t slow them. If anything, it’s made them better hunters. They track by smell, by sound, and by whatever sense the Zone carved into their brains in place of vision.
One dog alone isn’t much of a threat — though it’ll still try to bite chunks out of you. The danger comes from the pack. They circle, flank, and drive their prey straight into ambush. I’ve watched rookies laugh at the first one that comes growling, only to be screaming seconds later when five more tear in from the sides.
Behavior: opportunistic. They’ll scavenge corpses as quick as they’ll run down a living man. Loud noises draw them — gunfire especially. Packs often shadow stalkers for kilometers, waiting until fatigue sets in or ammunition runs low.
I’ve noticed something odd over the years: they don’t always attack. Sometimes they just linger at the edge of campfires, keeping their distance, heads tilted, listening. Like they’re waiting for something. Makes my skin crawl.
Harvestable components: pelts (poor quality, but traders sometimes take them), meat (severely irradiated — do not consume), and occasionally teeth used for charms.
Advice? Don’t underestimate them. If you hear growling in the grass, assume the pack is already in motion. Best defense is firepower and awareness. Or, if you’re smart, don’t be there when they come sniffing.
— The Guide

item.title: Bloodsucker
item.description:
#GOC #Research

#GOC #Research
[!infobox|light]+
“Img” is not created yet. Click to create.

📓 MUTANT DOSSIER – “Bloodsucker”
Category: Tier III Threat
Disposition: Highly aggressive, ambush predator
Common Locations: Marshes, abandoned structures, deep forests, subterranean tunnels
If the Zone has nightmares, the Bloodsucker is the shape they take. Tall, gaunt, wrapped in corded muscle under a leathery hide. The head alone is enough to freeze a man’s heart — mandibles splitting wide, tendrils thrashing, a mouth built for one thing: draining the life out of whatever it catches.
They hunt alone. Silent, patient. Their gift is worse than their claws — an ability to fade from sight, bending light around their bodies until they’re little more than a shimmer in the air. You won’t hear them. You won’t smell them. You’ll only know when they’re on top of you, mandibles locked around your throat.
Behavior: apex predator. They toy with prey, sometimes dragging bodies back to lairs. I’ve seen nests littered with half-eaten corpses — stalkers, loners, even mutants. Some whisper they’re intelligent, that they plan their hunts. I can’t prove that, but I’ve looked into one’s eyes, and I didn’t see animal hunger. I saw calculation.
Defenses: difficult to detect when cloaked. Thermal optics help, as does throwing bolts or debris to catch movement. They’re vulnerable to sustained fire, though many stalkers don’t get the chance to reload once one’s in striking distance. Shotguns work best up close.
Harvestable components: tendril clusters (valuable to Ecologists and certain black-market traders). Hide sometimes traded for study. Meat is inedible — rancid with radiation.
Advice? If you suspect a Bloodsucker is near, assume you’re already being hunted. Keep your back to a wall, your weapon loaded, and your nerves steady. Don’t panic when the air shimmers. If you panic, you’re already dead.
— The Guide

item.title: Flesh
item.description:
#GOC #Research

#GOC #Research
[!infobox|light]+
“Img” is not created yet. Click to create.


Category: Tier I Threat
Disposition: Neutral-aggressive
Common Locations: Open fields, near abandoned farms, shallow woodlands
One of the more grotesquely common mutants in the Zone. The Flesh resembles a hairless, overgrown pig; though calling it a pig does a disservice to bacon. Its hide is thick, leathery, and often torn, stretched unnaturally around warped bone and muscle that shouldn’t exist in nature. Eyes are human-like, unsettlingly so. There's thought behind them. Not much, but enough to watch. Enough to wait.
It moves in herds, usually slow, sometimes grazing like livestock; until it smells blood or hears a gunshot. Then it charges. Quick for its bulk. Powerful jaws. I’ve seen one rip a man's thigh clean open before he could reload.
Ecologists speculate it was once livestock exposed to radiation or mutated from swine stock scavenging the Zone’s dead zones. Some stalkers think they're failed experiments. Me? I think they're proof the Zone doesn't forget what we fed it. It just spits it back, wrong.
Harvestable components: Eye, sell to Duty (GOC)
Don’t provoke unless you’re hungry or bored. Better to let them pass and stay unseen. There are worse things out there that come running when a Flesh starts squealing.
Sneaky little fuckers. Almost silent. Keep head on swivel.
— The Guide

item.title: Izlom
item.description:
#GOC #Research

#GOC #Research
[!infobox|light]+
“Img” is not created yet. Click to create.


Category: Tier II Threat
Disposition: Unpredictable
Common Locations: Abandoned industrial zones, ruins, deep woodland clearings
The Izlom is something that shouldn’t be; a thing that walks like a man but is anything but. You’ll know one when you see it: long, lurching limbs, one arm dragging like it's dead weight, the other overdeveloped and jittering. Legs twisted but functional, gait somewhere between a drunk and a predator. The face is the worst part; almost human, if you squint, and it never stops grinning.
Most stalkers write them off as madmen in the late stages of mutation; maybe ex-military or researchers caught in radiation Pockets too long. Whatever they were, that person is long gone. What’s left is a creature that mimics humanity just enough to make your skin crawl.
Behaviour varies. I’ve seen them mumble and stagger away like drunk philosophers. I’ve also seen them fly into a rage at the snap of a twig and beat a man into mulch with one arm. They’re strong. Disturbingly strong. And fast, despite the limp.
Some factions say they can talk; not just groan or howl, but actually speak. I’ve only heard them mutter gibberish. One repeated "Don't go down" over and over again while eating a dog carcass. Didn’t stay to ask what he meant.
Harvestable components: not much. Maybe tissue samples for the Eggheads. Hands mostly sell with Duty (GOC). They’re more valuable dead and documented than anything else. I don’t trust the meat, even to sell. Something about them feels... tainted, deeper than radiation or rot.
Avoid if possible. Kill if necessary. And if it starts talking; don't listen.
— The Guide

item.title: Wild Cat
item.description:
#GOC #Research

#GOC #Research
[!infobox|light]+
“Img” is not created yet. Click to create.

📓 MUTANT DOSSIER – “Wild Cat”
Category: Tier I Threat
Disposition: Predatory
Common Locations: Forest edges, abandoned settlements, tall grass and scrub zones
The Zone doesn’t lack for predators, but the Wild Cat is one of the purest hunters out here. Imagine a lynx or mountain lion dragged through the Aether, stretched and hardened into something leaner, hungrier, and meaner. They move low, almost silent, muscles like coiled wire under patchy fur. Their eyes shine even when there’s no light to catch — green, burning, too aware.
Unlike Flesh or Dogs, Cats hunt alone or in pairs. They don’t waste energy. They stalk. Wait. Watch. And when they decide to move, it’s already too late. I’ve seen one leap clean from the roof of a farmhouse onto a stalker, knocking him flat before he even drew his pistol. The claws do the work — long, curved, and strong enough to carve through thick canvas or even the lighter plates of a stalker vest.
They don’t roar or howl. The Zone made them quiet. The only warning is the silence before they strike — birds scatter, dogs shut up, even the wind seems to die. That’s when you should get your rifle ready.
Ecologists think they’re mutated big cats, maybe from zoo stock or circus animals left behind when everything went to hell. Some stalkers whisper that they were bred deliberately, experiments in predation. I don’t much care. Out here, the “why” doesn’t matter. Only the “how fast can you kill it before it kills you.”
Harvestable components: pelts (fetch good prices with traders), claws (sometimes taken as trophies or sold for trinkets). Meat is foul, tainted with radiation. Don’t bother.
Advice? Never turn your back in the bush. If you feel eyes on you, you’re probably right. And if you catch a glimpse of fur vanishing between trees — you might already be in its sights.
— The Guide

item.title: 20240719 - Rostok Route
item.description:
#LITZ #Journal #ExpeditionLog

#LITZ #Journal #ExpeditionLog


Proceeded to Rostok with Walter Shenoski





Walter Shenoski and I were going to head to Rostok (LITZ), he had some stuff to sell and I needed to learn the route. We were joined by another random Loner (LITZ) we found at Rookie Village (GOC). He was a little strange and monotone and at the time we didn't realise what would happen next. Turns out the guy was Monolith (LITZ), they were after me. Turns out I am Most Wanted.
We made our way to North Farm to stop off during the dark. While there, the random Loner turned on us. Attacked and tried to rob us. I surrendered but Walter Shenoski ended up killing the guy, but his gear got wrecked. We laughed it off and headed further North.

WARNING Radiation / Pseudodog
We headed north through the Military checkpoint and on the road north, we were attacked by a Pseuddog. We had to run due to being close to the Bandits (LITZ).

We went east and circled around to avoid going North past the Bandits (LITZ) HQ in the Train Yard. I went loud by accident after we were attacked by BlindDogs. We had to run as fast as we could.

We stopped off at Flea Market (LITZ), there were two Stash's, one in the basement and one in the roof.

We headed North, attacked by a few dogs. It was close to an Emission and we made a run for it. Hiding in the bunker just outside the entrance.

Unfortunatly that was where it all went bad. We headed inside and were immedietly jumped by a pair of Monolith (LITZ). Walter Shenoski was killed for chatting shit and I was let go. The guy at the start had been in contact with his brothers.
I went inside and met a Duty (LITZ) guy. He had been jumped by them too, managing to kill the one he'd seen.

I made a return run for Cordon (LITZ), only getting into trouble with a dog but otherwise, made it back nice and safe.


Monolith tried to assassinate me. Found out later I was a HVT on their list, because I helped people.
item.guid: Life In the Zone/Journal/Old/Expedition Logs/20240719 - Rostok Route.md

item.title: 20240721 - Swamp Interim
item.description:
#LITZ #Journal #ExpeditionLog

#LITZ #Journal #ExpeditionLog






Heading North West from Rookie Village (GOC), I headed along the path that I used to take towards Swamp (LITZ). Careful of any mutants.
Spotted the tower and the small caravan. Radiation close to the water south of it but safe place for safety during an emission if on the way to the Swamp.
Found a Stash on the highest point of the tower, on the support.

Heading along the path, I spotted the ruins through my binocs and noted zombies in the vacinity. I was careful for radiation and had been careful for mutants on the way but was attacked by a Pseudodog. It damaged my kit and I would have to replace my eyepatch again. I need to go to Rostok (LITZ) to go get a bunch.
Killed the dog and the zombies, looted and found a Stash in one of the buildings. Contains Blue Stash with rifle inside.

I headed into the camp, finding radiation, I searched the buildings; there was a lot of waterproof bags. Was attacked by BlindDogs.

Small camp on theh ill between watered ruin camp and bus station. Stash there.
On the approach, there was radiation Note, Stay on the bridge and head straight North to the station next time. Was attacked by 4x Boar when an Emission started. Took cover in the bus station. Found a [[Stash].]

Going north from the bus station, I entered the first building and immedietly heared a strange noise, I spotted a Bloodsucker and fucked right off. Saw some loot but not much.

Hole in a fence across from Mark 1 fence. Able to cross to Northern approach and onto rail.
item.guid: Life In the Zone/Journal/Old/Expedition Logs/20240721 - Swamp Interim.md

item.title: 01 - Log
item.description:
#LITZ

#LITZ
The Guide entered the Zone with no memory, but a clear intention. To help people. He had been here before, done this all before but everytime he seems to be back at the start
Robbed by the Military upon entering, The Guide was helped by a few Loners to get a starting kit.
Running into the Outlaw Network, The Guide made friends easily and became a prospect. All went relatively well, until that fateful night.
Guiding some new blood around the Zone, they were attacked in Farm. The Guide was shot in the head, left for dead, he managed to survive and recover, well enough. Now he goes around, 7.62x39 lodged in his brain. Yet still helping the STALKERS of the Zone.
Monolith Capture

item.title: Building
item.description:
Double Doors

Fence

2x Wooden logs
18x Planks (5x Wooden logs)
36x Nails

Splitting Axe

Shovel

Pickaxe

Hammer

Hatchet

Hacksaw

Handsaw
Note: You will need one or the other of the Shovel and Pickaxe. The handsaw and hacksaw can be used to saw or make planks.
Crafting
The basic Kits:
a wooden pallet + 5 Planks:

Table Kit
Cabinet Kit
Bed Kit
Sofa Kit
Box Kit
Special Kit
Furniture Kits have multiple "pallet slots". Depending on how many pallets you put into your kit, you can place different Things.
Table Kit
1 Pallet = Small table. --- 2 Pallets = Medium table. --- 3 Pallets = Large table.
Bed Kit
3 Pallets = Small bed. --- 4 Pallets = Large bed.
Sofa Kit
!! BUGGED !!
2 Pallets = Small sofa. --- 3 Pallets = Medium sofa. --- 4 Pallets = Large sofa.
Cabinet Kit
1 Pallet = Pallet Shelf (for up to 3 wooden crates). 2 Pallets = Gun Cabinet. --- 3 Pallets = Medium Cabinet. --- 4 Pallets = Large Cabinet.
Old Wooden Crate (required for the Medium Cabinet):
10 Planks + 16 Nails
Special Kit
2 Pallets = Trashcan. --- 3 Pallets = Workbench. --- 5 Pallets = Greenhouse. --- 4 Fabric = Log Storage Place
Box Kit
Instead of slots for pallets, you need to put pallet frames in this Kit (max 4). The more frames you use, the bigger is the box you can place.
A Frame requires 4 Planks and 24 Nails
Stove Kit
combine a empty barrel + a Hacksaw.
Fill the material Slot of the Kit (10 Metal Sheets) to place the Stove.
Rain Collector Kit
combine a wooden pallet + 4 Metal Sheets.
Fill the material Slot of the Kit (4 fabric) to place the Rain Collector.
CRAFTING ON THE WORKBENCH:
Old Fridge
10 metal plates, 1 metal wire and an electronic repair kit.
Tool in your Hands: Screwdriver
Currently the fridge doesn't need to be powered (may change in future updates) but will increase the hold time of food. By default food will hold 3 times longer - but this may vary because it is configurable.
Repairbench
10 metal plates, 10 wooden planks and 30 nails.
Tool in your Hands: Screwdriver
The repairbench acts as a repair booster. Add repairkits to the repairbench and take the damaged item in your hands to use the bench.
The repairbench repairs faster, can repair to pristine and your attached repairkits will last longer.
Small Spotlight
1 metal plate, 1 metal wire and 25% of an electronic repair kit.
Tool in your Hand: Screwdriver
This small Spotlight can be powered by a 9V Battery and can be placed on the Ground.
It also works in artificial darkness areas like bunkers.
Desk Lamp
1 metal plate, 3 wooden planks and 25% of an electronic repair kit.
Tool in your Hand: Screwdriver
You can change the position of the lamps head. The desk lamp will also work in artificial darkness.
Floor Lamp
a metal pipe, 1 metal wire, 2 wooden planks and 25% of an electronic repair kit
Tool in your Hand: Screwdriver
The floor lamp needs to be powered from external sources - like a generator or a truck battery with wire.
It's an all-around light and therefore is disabled to work in artificial darkness for performance reasons.
Solar Panel
10 metal plates, 1 metal wire and an electronic repair kit.
Tool in your Hand: Blowtorch
The solarpanel requires a truck battery to work. It needs to be turned on to charge the battery at daytime.
Firewood Storage Place
4 metal plates
Tool in your Hand: Blowtorch
A small storage place for firewood, wooden sticks and other stuff to make a cozy fire.
Coffee Machine
10 metal plates, 1 metal wire and an electronic repair kit.
Tool in your Hand: Blowtorch
A cool retro coffee machine to make you a cup of coffee. Add a bag of coffee beans and fill the machine with water. Doesn't need to be powered (may change in future updates)

item.description:
New to the Zone?
Lost and hungry?
The Guide is here to help. Get top-tier assistance, food, and supplies
tailored for STALKERs.
Your journey is my mission.
Safe travels, every step of the way.
Work Offered includes:

Artefact Hunting Training & Collection
Mutant Hunting Training & Collection
Destination Guide
Package and Letter Delivery
Basic and Advanced Medical Treatment . Wounded? Sick?
Need patching up? The Guide can help.
Medical Survival Lessons / Learn how to treat wounds,
recognize anomalies' effects, and survive injuries in the field.
Seek The Guide.
Signed,
The Guide
